review.title: “The new IDS”
review.pros: Pros – Alternative workweek (every other Friday off), lots of smart & talented individuals, new management is bringing about more internal promotions and a better office environment, great benefits, company is experiencing a lot of growth - excited to see what's to come.
review.cons: Cons – Training opportunities aren't available for everyone
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep going in the right direction

review.title: “Great place to work”
review.pros: Pros – Positive work environmentGood advancement opportunityLateral movement is very possibleChallengingCausal environmentCompany is growing fast
review.cons: Cons – There are some bad apples, but there are bad apples at every company.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – No advice as of now.

review.title: “Pretty good place to work”
review.pros: Pros – -Excellent Benefits package-Smart people-Well-established, stable company-Good products-Good, solid management with open communication-No micromanagement
review.cons: Cons – -Working with development team overseas can be challenging-Not typical 8-5 day, much is expected-No Extra budget for technology or professional development
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Work a little more on company culture. Continue to work towards making the work environment a place people want to come to.

review.title: “Not the best place to work”
review.pros: Pros – Benefits are goodPay is good for both professionals (Marketing, Finance, etc) and customer service departmentSchedule is flexible for both professionals and customer service
review.cons: Cons – Some really bad apples there.A lot of politics and gossip within the office.No growth opportunity. There have been people in the same position for 5+ years that are well over qualified for their current position.Communication is very tough within departments.Everyone is very territorial.Lack of culture within the company.Micro managing from the top down.Opinions and new ideas are usually shot down.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Listen to your employees. There are some good people there that don't get their voice heard.
